channel.title: Talawanda High School News
channel.description: Newsletter items from Talawanda High School

item.title: Community Food Resources and Meal Schedules
item.description:
Information is available for families in need of food assistance, including: - Community meals calendar and TOPPS schedule for Talawanda area - Butler County food pantries directory with complete listings - SNAP (food assistance) program information and how to apply

These resources provide support for families seeking meal programs and food assistance in the Butler County community.

View original newsletter

item.title: PUSH Program Home Repair Grants Available
item.description:
The PUSH Program offers grants to low-income homeowners within the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs.

For more information or to apply: - Contact Jeanne or Sabrina at 513-523-8100 - Visit: http://www.push-oxford.org/

View original newsletter

item.title: FCCLA Hosts Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly
item.description:
FCCLA is hosting a Veterans Day breakfast and assembly on November 11th. Veterans are invited to attend and should RSVP at this link to join the event.

View original newsletter

item.title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
item.description:
BRAVE Day is Talawanda High School's annual family-building and diversity event for sophomores, taking place Friday, November 14th. The day focuses on anti-bullying and personal empowerment through story-sharing, activities, and listening, helping students realize they have a supportive community at THS. This program has been running since 2009 and participation is optionalâ€”students who prefer not to attend should stay in their regular classes.

View original newsletter

For more information about FCCLA and its activities, students should contact the organization's advisors or check for updates in future newsletters.

item.title: Club Meetings Schedule for November 3-7
item.description:
Weekly club meetings scheduled November 3-7:

  • Monday, Nov 3: Diversity Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 400), Setting Stone (2:30pm, room 320), Tribune (2:30pm, room 315)
  • Tuesday, Nov 4: NO SCHOOL for students; Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315)
  • Wednesday, Nov 5: Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412, all welcome)
  • Thursday, Nov 6: Best Buddies Tutorial (Cafeteria), Chess Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Key Club Tutorial (room 218), Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315), Project Green (2:30-3:30pm, room 224), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412)
  • Friday, Nov 7: Drama (2:30-5:30pm, PAC)

View original newsletter

item.title: End of Course (EOC) Testing
item.description:
EOC Testing is taking place at Talawanda High School. Students will be completing End of Course examinations, which are standardized tests administered at the conclusion of specific courses. Further details about testing schedules and affected courses should be available through the school office or official communications.

View original newsletter

item.title: Upcoming Events and Important Dates
item.description:
This Week's Events: - Sunday, October 26th, 6:00 PM - Girls Soccer Banquet (Cafeteria) - Tuesday, October 28th, 6:00 PM - Trunk or Treat (Parking Lot) - Wednesday, October 29th, 6:00 PM - TMS Football Awards (Cafeteria)

Looking Ahead: Tuesday, November 4th is a no-school day for students due to Election Day.

item.description:

  • Monday 10/27: Setting Stone (2:30pm, room 320); Diversity Club & Tribune cancelled
  • Tuesday 10/28: Art Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Best Buddies (2:30-3:15pm, hallway trick or treat), Mock Trial (5:00-7:00pm, room 315), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412)
  • Wednesday 10/29: Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412)
  • Thursday 10/30: Chess Club (2:30-3:30pm, room 603), Project Green (2:30-3:30pm, Natural Areas Celebration), Robotics Club (2:30-4:00pm, room 412); Mock Trial cancelled
  • Friday 10/31: Drama (2:30-5:30pm, PAC), Marching Band (5:30-7:00pm, PAC)

item.title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Instructions
item.description:
Seniors must submit their yearbook portraits by March 27th using the upload link: https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0jPvxM8 (access code: talawanda2026).

Requirements: - Portrait format (not landscape) - File size greater than 1MB - Follow student code of conduct - Black and white photos discouraged

Don't wait until the last minute!

View original newsletter

item.title: Parent-Teacher Conference Scheduling Information
item.description:
Talawanda High School schedules parent-teacher conferences in 15-minute increments with individual teachers. When requesting a conference, parents should provide their availability and list the specific teachers they wish to meet with to help the school coordinate effectively.

item.title: RISE Research Study for 5th Graders with ADHD
item.description:
Cincinnati Children's RISE (Resilience In Student Education) project is seeking 5th grade students with ADHD or attention/hyperactivity challenges to participate in a research study. Caregivers and students can earn up to $320 for completing questionnaires about academics, organization skills, and social-emotional well-being.

To participate: Complete the interest form, email RISEstudy@cchmc.org, call 513-803-6321, or visit studentresilience.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Early Bird Yearbook Sale Ends September 30th
item.description:
Talawanda High School yearbooks are now available for $70 through the Early Bird sale at yearbookforever.com (search "Talawanda" and select High School). The price increases to $75 after September 30th. All yearbooks will be mailed to the address provided when ordering. If you're moving, contact yearbook@talawanda.org in the Fall to arrange pickup at the main office.

View original newsletter

item.title: Sources of Strength Program
item.description:
Sources of Strength is a peer-led prevention program at Talawanda High School. This initiative focuses on building connections and promoting mental health and wellness within the school community.
